title: Setup
text:
Install Git
To install on Windows, download the executable from here.

title: Setup
text:
Update Git
On Windows, run the following command.
git update-git-for-windows






Note



If you already have the latest version it just returns:
# Git for Windows 2.45.1.windows.1 (64-bit)
# Up to date

title: Setup
text:
Version
The following command returns the version number currently installed.
git version
## git version 2.45.1.windows.1






Note



Alternatively you can use git -v or git --version.

title: Setup
text:
Setup Identity
Every Git commit uses your user name and email address. These can be set up using the following commands.
git config --global user.name "<your name>"
git config --global user.email "<your email>"
You have to do this only once for any computer. You can also change them at any time by running through the commands again.

title: Setup
text:
Setup Default Branch Name
By default Git creates a initial branch called master. To set a different name, for example main, run:
git config --global init.defaultBranch main

title: Setup
